etymologies: early 17th century; earliest use found in Thomas Godwin (?1587–1642), schoolmaster. From (i) Hellenistic Greek ἀσσάριον (neuter)

definitions: A copper coin of small value, issued in Greek-speaking parts of the Roman empire.

notes.text: The Greek word ἀσσάριον appears in Matthew 10:29; it is usually translated as ‘farthing’ or (in more recent translations) ‘penny’.
